meanings.definition: Treat (a person or their illness) with medicine.
meanings.sent1: The doctor will medicate the patient to help them feel better.
meanings.sent2: It is important to medicate a fever to bring down the temperature.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally medicated my cat instead of myself!
meanings.sent4: Her soothing words medicated his troubled mind like a healing balm.
meanings.sent5: The medicine will medicate the pain in your stomach quickly.

meanings.definition: Administer medicine to (someone), typically in order to relieve pain or fever.
meanings.sent1: She will medicate her son with cough syrup to help him sleep.
meanings.sent2: The nurse will medicate the patient before the surgery.
meanings.sent3: He tried to medicate his headache with a funny movie.
meanings.sent4: The music seemed to medicate her soul, easing her worries.
meanings.sent5: The doctor will medicate you with antibiotics to fight the infection.
